channel.title: Port forwarding problem
channel.description:
I need help on my port forwarding...my router is weird I cant find how to set up Portwarding on my router page....
[URL=http://www.picoodle.com/view.php?img=/9/7/27/f_untitledm_51c5739.png&srv=img02][IMG]http://img02.picoodle.com/img/img02/9/7/27/f_untitledm_51c5739.png[/img][/URL]
my router page...i went through config but didnt find anything...is there another way around this? if anyone has this Westell VersaLink model 327W router please help me.

item.title: Port forwarding problem
item.dc:creator: @Coldbloodio Coldbloodio
item.description:
@Coldbloodio wrote:

myhome.westell.com:2383

so would 2383 be my port?

[br][size=1]Posted on: July 27, 2007, 07:59:14 PM[/size][hr]all my thing says is servername is now online!

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding problem
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

http://www.portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/Westell/Versalink327W/1st_SMTP_Server.htm

Go there, and instead of the port they tell you, use the port that your server runs on. You can check this when you run your server, because it will say

Starting Server on 0.0.0.0:[b]43594[/b]

Or something similiar and the bolded part is the port you have to port-forward.

Read full topic
